snippet: Despite signs of gains in various sectors, the United States’ economy is not likely to top last year’s lackluster performance, according to an International Monetary Fund report.
abstract: International Monetary Fund forecasts that United States economy will grow modest 2 percent in 2014, down from previous estimate of 2.7 percent.
lead_paragraph: Despite signs of gains in various sectors, the United States’ economy is not likely to top last year’s lackluster performance, according to an International Monetary Fund report.

headline.main: I.M.F. Lowers Its Forecast for U.S. Growth This Year
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Lowers Its Forecast for U.S. Growth This Year
